business.headline: HDFC Bank introduces revised lending and FD rates. Check detailsHDFC Bank lowers MCLR by up to 5 bps, revises FD rates, offering financial relief and flexibility for borrowers and depositors.
ITR filing: Submit these investment proofs to claim deductions and save on TDSSubmit proofs promptly to reduce TDS, maximise tax savings, and ensure smooth compliance before filing your ITR.

India's GDP growth may hit 4-year low of 6.4% in FY25, shows government dataThe slowdown in the government's first advance estimates highlights a more tempered pace of economic activity and indicates that the economy could grow at the slowest pace in four years.
Sensex, Nifty recover after Monday's slump; RIL gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex added 234.12 points to close at 78,199.11, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 91.85 points to end at 23,707.90.
Explained: Why Paras Defence share price surged 10% todayParas Defence and Space Technologies Ltd designs, develops, manufactures, and tests a range of products for the defence and space sectors.

Budget 2025: How new tax regime evolved over the years and what's next?As Budget 2025 nears, more changes to the new tax regime are expected to simplify taxes and benefit salaried employees and pensioners.
Junior employees at HCLTech to get up to 4% salary increase: ReportRecently, Infosys, a major competitor, announced 90% performance bonuses for the second quarter ending September.

Will Q3 results deepen Dalal Street sell-off? 3 stocks to watch amid uncertaintySensex and Nifty plunged over 1.5%, and the Nifty PSU Bank suffered a loss of close to 4% in Monday's bloodbath on Dalal Street. The Q3 earnings season is set to kick off with TCS announcing its results on January 9.

Explained: Why MobiKwik share price jumped nearly 12% despite reporting Q2 lossMobikwik stock price today: The sharp rally came despite the company reporting a consolidated net loss of Rs 3.59 crore in Q2 FY25, compared to a profit of Rs 5.23 crore in Q2 FY24.
SBI Har Ghar Lakhpati Scheme: Eligibility, features and interest rates explained SBI's Har Ghar Lakhpati RD helps individuals achieve Rs 1 lakh with small monthly investments and attractive returns.

Budget 2025: Will new income tax regime steal the spotlight again?Budget 2025 tax expectations: The upcoming budget may focus on the new income tax regime yet again to increase its appeal compared to the old tax regime.

ITR filing: Technical glitch keeps Section 87A rebate unavailable for taxpayersTaxpayers remain unable to claim the Section 87A rebate on STCG income due to outdated ITR processing logic, even after recent updates to filing forms by the Income Tax Department.

Is Zomato's dream stock market run over? Zomato's share price has declined over 9% in the past 5 trading sessions and over 14% in a month. At around 12:05 pm, shares of the company were trading 4.38% lower at Rs 253.05.

Delta Autocorp IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band and other detailsDelta Autocorp IPO open for bidding: The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 54.60 crore, comprising a fresh issue of 38.88 lakh shares amounting to Rs 50.54 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.12 lakh shares, aggregating to Rs 4.06 crore.

Budget 2025: Trade Unions join pre-budget discussions with Nirmala SitharamanBudget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held pre-Budget talks with trade unions to shape the Union Budget 2025-26, focusing on economic challenges and growth ahead of its February 1 presentation.

Stock market recovers after yesterday's crash. What's next on Dalal Street?Stock market recovery today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.11 points to 78,219.10 at 11:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 115.75 points to trade at 23,735.10.

Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Check GMP, price band, subscription Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares.
Explained: Why Biocon share price jumped over 7% todayBiocon stock price: At around 10:45 am, shares of the company were trading 7.22% higher at Rs 384.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Zomato share price falls as Jefferies downgrade; target price cut to Rs 275At 10:33 am, Zomato's stock price was down 4.19% to Rs 253.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the shares of Zomato hit an intra-day low of Rs 251.55.
Indo Farm Equipment shares list at 19% premium over IPO price Indo Farm Equipment stock price: The company's shares were listed at Rs 256 each on the NSE, a 19.07% gain from the issue price.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Death toll rises to 126 after six earthquakes rock TibetTremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and many parts of North India on Tuesday following a 7.1 magnitude earthquake in Tibet, near the Nepal border.
Isro to get new chief: Dr V Narayanan to take over from S Somnath on Jan 14Distinguished Scientist at Isro, Dr V Narayanan is currently the Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).

Meta to replace fact-checkers with X-style community notes. Elon Musk approvesMeta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the overhauling of Facebook's censorship policies, removing fact-checkers, and adopting a community-driven moderation system inspired by Elon Musk's X.

Delhi Chief Minister bungalow row heats up as poll dates announcedAAP accused the BJP of trying to throw Delhi Chief Minister Atishi out of her official residence. The BJP, while denying the claims, accused Atishi of never moving into the house to avoid upsetting Arvind Kejriwal.

Actor Ajith Kumar's narrow escape after race car crashes during practiceAjith Kumar's car crashed during a practice session for the Dubai Grand Prix, but the actor emerged unhurt. Kumar returned to car racing competitions after 15 years, following multiple injuries.

Centre allots site for Pranab Mukherjee's memorial, his daughter thanks PMPranab Mukherjee's daughter, Sharmistha Mukherjee, expressed her gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the decision, calling it a "gracious" and "unexpected" gesture.

Many Indians among 185 employees fired by Apple for salary fraud, says report185 employees have been fired by Apple for misusing a grants clause to gain higher salary from the company. Of these, many are said to be Indians.

Water level hits 100 feet in Assam mine where 9 trapped, Navy divers deployedNavy divers from Visakhapatnam were deployed to speed up rescue operations of the labourers trapped in a rat-hole mine in Assam.  The teams of the National Disaster Response Force and the State Disaster Response Force are already on the spot.

OnePlus 13 launched in India: Prices, full specifications, sale details and moreOnePlus has launched its latest flagship, the OnePlus 13, in India with a starting price of Rs 69,999. The phone, which will go on sale via Amazon, brings several upgrades.

Meet Anita Anand, Indo-Canadian Minister and likely successor to Justin TrudeauAnita Anand, the Indian-origin Transport Minister, is a top contender to succeed Justin Trudeau. Born in Nova Scotia to Indian physician parents, she has held key roles in the incumbent Canadian government.

Delhi to vote on February 5, results on 8th, AAP eyes hat-trickDelhi Election Schedule: The Delhi elections will witness a fierce triangular contest between the AAP, BJP and the Congress. The ruling AAP, battling a wave of corruption allegations, will be eyeing a hat-trick.

Bangladesh revokes passports of former PM Sheikh Hasina, 96 othersPassports of a total of 97 individuals, including the ousted prime minister, have been revoked in the wake of the criminal proceedings against these individuals in the country.

Silence is a profound melody: Chahal drops another cryptic postIndian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has reignited speculation about his personal life by sharing a cryptic social media post amid persistent rumours regarding his divorce from Dhanashree Verma.

X suspends UK journalist after she investigates Elon Musk fan account A journalist claimed that her X account was suspended, and an article by her was blocked on the platform after she wrote a piece about online theories suggesting that an X account was secretly run by Elon Musk himself.

Can Tamil Nadu unlock the secrets of the Indus Valley script?The Indus script remains one of history's great mysteries. Recent findings in Tamil Nadu, like Keezhadi, reveal striking links to the Indus Valley. Could these connections help decode the ancient script?

Manjrekar backs Jasprit Bumrah as full-time Test captain despite injury concernsFormer cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has backed Jasprit Bumrah as the full-time Test captain in case Rohit Sharma decides to step down from the position. Manjrekar has backed the pacer despite concerns about his workload.

Sean Diddy accusers' lawyers criticise Nikki Glaser's jokes at Golden GlobesNikki Glaser's opening monologue at the 2025 Golden Globes drew criticism from lawyers representing Sean Diddy Combs' accusers. They found Glaser's jokes in poor taste.
Cars that redefined luxury in 2024From performance icons to silent EVs, the vehicles that made every journey memorable with their comfort, capability and class

5 ex-Naxals among 8 security personnel killed in Chhattisgarh blastHead Constable Budhram Korsa, constables Dumma Markam, Pandaru Ram, Baman Sodhi and constable Somdu Vetti of Bastar Fighters were earlier active as Naxalites.

Symptoms to expert advice: Your detailed HMPV guideHuman metapneumovirus (HMPV) is garnering attention due to rising cases in China and advisories in Indian states like Karnataka and Maharashtra. While it's not a new virus, concerns are heightened because of limited research and public awareness. Here's everything you need to know about the virus.

Mayhem in Mecca as extreme rain submerges city, gushing waters wash away carsFloodwaters have engulfed cars, stranded buses, and prompted widespread rescues in Mecca and its surroundings, including Jeddah, reports the Saudi Press Agency (SPA). Thunderstorms, heavy rain, and hail have hit Mecca and Medina. Rescue operations are underway.

Can Nikola Tesla's idea of free, limitless energy be turned into reality today?On Nikola Tesla's death anniversary, we are diving into his visionary free energy idea conceptualised by the Wardenclyffe Tower, and examining whether the 'mad' genius' idea is feasible with today's technology.

India's GDP growth may hit 4-year low of 6.4% in FY25, shows government dataThe slowdown in the government's first advance estimates highlights a more tempered pace of economic activity and indicates that the economy could grow at the slowest pace in four years.

States have money for freebies but not to pay judges: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court noted that while state governments have funds for announcing election freebies, they often cite financial constraints in paying judges' salaries.

Ananya Panday on bullying, insecurities: Was called hunchback, flat screen TVIn a candid interview, Ananya Panday revealed past bullying experiences and her ongoing struggle with beauty standards in the film industry. She emphasised the importance of authenticity amid these pressures.

Kangana Ranaut: Got courage for Emergency because there is freedom of speech today Actor Kangana Ranaut is gearing up for the release of her most-awaited film, Emergency. Ahead of that, she revealed the challenges she and her team faced during the making of the film.

Govinda's wife Sunita says nobody listens to his advice: He's stuck in 90s Actor Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja revealed why their son Yashvardan Ahuja doesn't take career advice from his father. Additionally, she shared insights on Govinda's bond with David Dhawan.
Ram Charan wants daughter Klin Kaara to watch this 2018 filmRam Charan wishes to introduce his daughter Klin Kaara to his iconic film Rangasthalam, highlighting its significance in his career.

sports.headline: Hockey India League: Kalinga Lancers thrash Bengal Tigers to claim 1st winKalinga Lancers produced a stunning performance to thrash Shrachi Rarh Bengal Tigers 6-0 to register their first win of the Hockey India League 2024-25. Thierry Brinkman was the star of the show for the Lancers in Rourkela.

After Ireland ODI snub, Shafali bangs on India selection doors with 91, 95Shafali Verma has chipped in with useful knocks of 91 and 95 for Team A in the Senior Women's One-Day Challenger Trophy. Earlier, Shafali missed out on a berth in the Indian team for the ODI series against Ireland.

Malaysia Open: Lakshya Sen suffers shock first round exit, loses to Chi Yu-jenAn inconsistent performance from Lakshya Sen saw the Indian shuttler suffer a shock exit from the Malaysia Open on Tuesday, January 7. Lakshya had unforced errors creep into his game on Tuesday.

Virat Kohli's antics during BGT slammed by Sunil Gavaskar: Simply not cricketSunil Gavaskar has slammed Virat Kohli's on-field antics during the recently-concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Gavaskar feels that Kohli put his teammates under pressure with his actions during the series against Australia.

England captain Ben Stokes calls himself 'bionic man' after hamstring surgeryEngland Test captain Ben Stokes hilariously called himself a 'bionic man' after undergoing surgery to fix his hamstring injury. Stokes sustained the injury while bowling during the New Zealand Test series.

Salah, Trent, Van Dijk performances not affected by contract talk: Arne SlotLiverpool boss Arne Slot has suggested that Mohamed Salah, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Virgil van Dijk are not being affected by the talk about their contract situation at the club. The trio's current deals are all set to expire in the summer of this year.

Neeraj Chopra doesn't need Jan Zelezny 365 days a year: SumariwallaOutgoing AFI President Adille Sumariwalla said that Indian javelin star Neeraj Chopra does not require coach Jan Zelezny for 365 days a year. Last year, Zelezny, a three-time Olympic champion, joined Chopra as his coach.

Leaky roof halts HS Prannoy's match, Viktor Axelsen out in 1st roundMalaysia Open 2024: A leaky roof affected quite a few matches on Day 1 of the Super 1000 tournament. HS Prannoy's first-round match was pushed to Wednesday. Meanwhile, defending Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen was stunned in the first round in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.

Kohli, Rohit should play domestic cricket and see how it is: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri has strongly endorsed a return to domestic cricket for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma after their horrendous run of form during the recently-concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Kohli and Rohit struggled to make an impact as India lost the series to the Aussies.

Smriti Mandhana nominated for Player of the Month award in December India's Smriti Mandhana, Australia's Annabel Sutherland and South Africa's Nonkululeko Mlaba are the nominees for the ICC Women's Player of the Month award for December.

Dasgupta expressed confidence that Kohli can bounce back from his struggles, provided he retains the hunger to address his shortcomings.

Dasgupta expressed confidence that Kohli can bounce back from his struggles, provided he retains the hunger to address his shortcomings.

Williamson, Smith unlikely to play Pakistan Super LeagueSteve Smith and Kane Williamson are unlikely to take part in the 2025 Pakistan Super League scheduled to take place in April-May. The PCB are also waiting for clearance from the ECB for England cricketers' participation in the tournament.

Why John Cena should win the WWE Royal Rumble 2025John Cena has started his farewell tour on WWE RAW's NetFlix debut and made his intentions clear of winning the Royal Rumble and headlining WrestleMania. We take a look at why WWE should pull the trigger on this scenario and allow Cena to win the Rumble match.

Sarfaraz Khan was completely dumped, don't think it was right: Sanjay ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar has expressed his displeasure at Sarfaraz Khan being completely 'dumped' from the Indian team for KL Rahul during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Sarfaraz didn't get a chance to play any matches during the series against Australia.

Tottenham Hotspur trigger one-year extension for captain Son Heung-MinTottenham Hotspur has decided to trigger the one-year extension in their captain Son Heung-Min's contract on Tuesday, January 7. Son has been with the club since 2025 and has made himself a legend with Spurs.

Pakistan face another blow after 0-2 defeat in South Africa Tests  Pakistan have been fined 25 percent of their match fees and docked five points in the World Test Championship after the New Year's Test against South Africa at the Newlands in Cape Town.

Hope BCCI allows more Indian players to participate in SA20: AB de VilliersLegendary AB de Villiers, brand ambassador of SA20, urged the Indian cricket board to allow more players to participate in the premier South African T20 tournament in the future.

South Africa ready to run through a brick wall to win WTC: Temba Bavuma Temba Bavuma led South Africa into the WTC final with a commanding seven-match Test-winning streak. The Proteas skipper promised an all-out effort, determined to end the nation's ICC title drought at Lord's this June.

After horror Test series vs India, Mitchell Marsh bags golden duck BBL 2024-25: Mitchell Marsh bagged a golden duck after Will Sutherland got his wicket in the match between the Perth Scorchers and Melbourne Renegades on Tuesday at the Optus Stadium.

Jasprit Bumrah vs Pat Cummins in battle for ICC Player of Month for DecemberICC Awards: Jasprit Bumrah, nominated for the Sir Garfield Sobers Award for the Best Men's Player of the Year, will compete with Australia captain Pat Cummins and South Africa pacer Dane Paterson for the Men's Player of the Month award for December.

Lleyton Hewitt's son fails to qualify for Australian Open main drawLleyton Hewitt's son Cruz lost to Georgia's Nikoloz Basilashvili in straight sets in the opening round of the Qualifiers and failed to make his way through to the main draw of the Australian Open 2025.

Watch: Coach Andy Murray joins Novak Djokovic in Australian Open trainingAustralian Open 2025: Coach Andy Murray oversaw Novak Djokovic's training session in Melbourne on Tuesday. Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz were setting hitting it out at the Margaret Court Arena.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
